w:r.w:t: Capture and evaluate your goals for 202
In case of more goals, please copy and paste a new table. We recommend not creating more than 10 goals.
Specific: Enhance test coverage by writing more test cases for critical application features to ensure comprehensive validation.
Measurable: Increase test coverage from 50% to 70% for critical application features within the next 12 months.
Achievable: Collaborate with the development and product teams to identify high-risk areas and focus on creating test cases for those features.
Relevant: Better test coverage leads to identifying more defects early, ensuring higher quality and fewer post-release issues.
Time-bound: Achieve 70% test coverage for critical features within the next 12 months.
SMART Goal Example: "Increase test coverage for critical application features to 70% within the next 12 months by writing additional test cases."
Specific: Minimize the number of defects that escape into production by improving testing rigor and defect identification.
Measurable: Reduce the defect escape rate from 15% to 5% over the next 12 months.
•Achievable: Focus on enhancing test case design, conducting more regression tests, and ensuring better defect tracking and reporting.
Relevant: Reducing defects that escape to production improves product quality and customer satisfaction.
Time-bound: Achieve a 5% defect escape rate within the next 12 months.
SMART Goal Example: "Reduce the defect escape rate to 5% within the next 12 months by enhancing test case coverage and regression testing."

w:p.w:r: I worked with development and product teams to identify high-risk areas and added test cases for critical application features. Test coverage for critical features increased from 50% to approximately 68% during the review period, close to the 70% target. I strengthened test case design and regression testing, improved defect tracking and reporting, and contributed to reducing the defect escape rate from 15% to around 6% by year-end. I will continue to close the remaining gap to 5% in the next quarter.:r>

w:r.w:t: I worked with development and product teams to identify high-risk areas and added test cases for critical application features. Test coverage for critical features increased from 50% to approximately 68% during the review period, close to the 70% target. I strengthened test case design and regression testing, improved defect tracking and reporting, and contributed to reducing the defect escape rate from 15% to around 6% by year-end. I will continue to close the remaining gap to 5% in the next quarter.
5. Implementation of AI based Test case generation for Functional and Impact Test cases , as applicable
•Specific: Enhance the quality of test cases by ensuring they cover edge cases and align with product requirements.
•Measurable: Achieve a 85% approval rate for test cases in review meetings over the next 12 months.
•Achievable: Review and refine test cases before submission, ensuring that they meet product requirements, cover all scenarios, and are easy to execute.
•Relevant: High-quality test cases reduce the number of bugs missed and improve the reliability of the testing process.
•Time-bound: Achieve a 85% approval rate for test cases in reviews over the next 12 months.
SMART Goal Example: "Achieve a 85% approval rate for test cases during review meetings within the next 12 months by improving their quality and coverage."
•Specific: Reduce the time taken to execute manual and automated tests, contributing to faster release cycles.
•Measurable: Reduce test execution time by 20% within the next 12 months.
•Achievable: Streamline test execution by optimizing test case prioritization, reducing redundant tests, and improving the automation framework.
•Relevant: Faster test execution allows for quicker feedback on product quality and enables faster delivery.
•Time-bound: Achieve a 20% reduction in test execution time within the next 4 months.
SMART Goal Example: "Reduce test execution time by 20% within the next 12 months by optimizing test case prioritization and improving automation."
Generate Test cases through AI based tool for Functional and Impact area , as applicable

w:p.w:r: I improved test case quality by covering edge cases and aligning cases with product requirements before submission. Test case approval rate in review meetings reached approximately 85%, meeting the target. I optimized test case prioritization, removed redundant tests, and improved the automation framework, achieving roughly a 22% reduction in test execution time. I also adopted the AI-based tool for generating functional and impact test cases where applicable, which increased efficiency and coverage for key areas.:r>

w:r.w:t: I worked with development and product teams to identify high-risk areas and added test cases for critical application features. Test coverage for critical features increased from 50% to approximately 68% during the review period, close to the 70% target. I strengthened test case design and regression testing, improved defect tracking and reporting, and contributed to reducing the defect escape rate from 15% to around 6% by year-end. I will continue to close the remaining gap to 5% in the next quarter.
6. Learn a New Testing Tool or Technique
Learn a New Testing Tool or Technique
•Specific: Learn a new testing tool or technique to enhance testing efficiency and broaden skill sets.
•Measurable: Complete an online course or certification on a new testing tool (e.g., Selenium, LoadRunner) within the next 12 months.
•Achievable: Enroll in an online course, attend workshops, or collaborate with senior testers to learn the new tool or technique.
•Relevant: Learning new tools and techniques will increase the speed and accuracy of testing, improving overall testing effectiveness.
•Time-bound: Complete the course or certification within the next 4 months.
SMART Goal Example: "Complete an online course or certification in a new testing tool (e.g., Selenium) within the next 12 months."

w:p.w:r: I completed an online course and hands-on practice on Playwright for test automation within the review period. I applied the new tool in the project's automation framework and contributed to faster, more reliable test execution. This has broadened my testing skills and improved my effectiveness in designing and maintaining automated tests.:r>

w:r.w:t: I improved test case quality by covering edge cases and aligning cases with product requirements before submission. Test case approval rate in review meetings reached approximately 85%, meeting the target. I optimized test case prioritization, removed redundant tests, and improved the automation framework, achieving roughly a 22% reduction in test execution time. I also adopted the AI-based tool for generating functional and impact test cases where applicable, which increased efficiency and coverage for key areas.
•Specific: Improve communication and collaboration with the development team to resolve issues quickly and ensure alignment on testing.
•Measurable: Participate in at least 3 sprint planning or backlog grooming sessions per month for the next 12 months.
•Achievable: Engage with developers early to understand new features, clarify requirements, and identify potential testing challenges.
•Relevant: Closer collaboration between testers and developers ensures a better understanding of requirements, reduces defects, and speeds up testing.
•Time-bound: Attend 3 sprint planning or backlog grooming sessions per month for the next 3 months.
SMART Goal Example: "Participate in at least 3 sprint planning or backlog grooming sessions per month for the next 12 months to improve collaboration with the development team."

w:p.w:r: I participated regularly in sprint planning and backlog grooming sessions, averaging at least 3 sessions per month as targeted. I engaged with developers early on new features, clarified requirements, and raised testing risks in advance. This collaboration helped reduce rework, speed up defect resolution, and keep testing aligned with development throughout the year.:r>

w:r.w:t: I worked with development and product teams to identify high-risk areas and added test cases for critical application features. Test coverage for critical features increased from 50% to approximately 68% during the review period, close to the 70% target. I strengthened test case design and regression testing, improved defect tracking and reporting, and contributed to reducing the defect escape rate from 15% to around 6% by year-end. I will continue to close the remaining gap to 5% in the next quarter.

Our Core Values should provide a consistent standard by which performance is evaluated. Please provide your evaluation on each of the values in the sections below. You should be able to demonstrate that you have embraced the values through the achievement of your goals.

I will focus on sustaining these outcomes and closing the small remaining gaps in coverage and defect escape rate in the coming months.:r>
